availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Green B. Hays (Larue County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Larue County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Julia A. Ashcraft Hays in Hardin County, Kentucky, on March 3, 1831. Father of John W. Hays, James R. Hays, Edward R. Hays, Henry Albin Hays, Jediah Hays, B. Franklin Hays, Em Hays, and Martha Hays. Farmer in Larue County in 1850. Farmer in Larue County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Larue County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, LaRue County, Hamiltons, p. 457A-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Larue County, p. 195.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Larue County, p. 328A.
"Green Berry Hayes (1812-1884)," Find A Grave, Memorial #12104630, accessed February 18, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/12104630.
Kentucky Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Hardin County Marriages, 1793-1862, Film #000390788.
